Package com.tinocs.mp.greenfoot

Class GreenfootEventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinocs.mp.greenfoot.GreenfootEventHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientEventHandler
    public abstract class GreenfootEventHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientEventHandler

    This is an implementation of the ClientEventHandler for Greenfoot games.

    This system is built on the core principal that actors will fall into one of three categories:
    1. LocalActor: An Actor whose state is controlled by this client. These actors will typically have an act method that performs actions every frame. Each LocalActor will be associated with a corresponding subclass of MPActor and an instance of that corresponding MPActor will mirror everything the LocalActor does on each other client. Each MPActor has an actorId and a clientId indicating which actor it represents across all clients and which client controls it, allowing messages to indicate which MPActor to call methods on. These actors can still be told to do something by another client via messages, but the controlling client will be the one that actually executes code to respond to the message.
    2. MPActor: Actors controlled by another client are repesented by subclasses of MPActor that are not subclasses of LocalActor. These will be the actors that mirror the state of a LocalActor controlled by another client. To change the state of one of these actors in a way that should be visible to other clients, a message should be sent to the controlling client to change the LocalActor associated with it, which will result in a broadcast telling all clients to do the same action to the corresponding MPActor in their program.
    3. Actor: Normal actors whose state is only relevant to the local client, such as HUD elements or whose state doesn't change, such as permanent scenery.

    In general whenever a LocalActor changes state (added to the world, image, position or rotation changes), the change is automatically broadcast to the other clients and the corresponding MPActor is updated.

    While calling Actor.setImage(String) on a LocalActor will result in a broadcast that changes the image of the corresponding MPActors on other clients, Actor.setImage(GreenfootImage) will not broadcast anything because there is no filename to pass. If you want to change the image to a generated image not simply read from a file, then you should create a custom method in the LocalActor that changes the image and also broadcasts to all the clients to call that same method on the corresponding MPActor. Then copy that method to the corresponding MPActor class.

    Version:
    5/7/2023
    Author:
    Ted McLeod

        The command will be in the form: senderId ADD className x y param1 param2 param3...

        The command will be in the form: senderId ROT actorId angle

        Constant Field Values

      • CMD_IMAGE

        public static final java.lang.String CMD_IMAGE

        Command to set the image of an actor to the image at the given url.

        The command will be in the form: senderId IMG actorId url

        Note that if you want to set the image to a modified image rather than an image located in a file, you should just make a custom method that does that and send a CMD_METHOD command.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CMD_TRANSPARENCY

        public static final java.lang.String CMD_TRANSPARENCY

        Command to set the transparency of an actor to the given value.

        The command will be in the form: senderId ALPHA actorId value
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CMD_METHOD

        public static final java.lang.String CMD_METHOD

        use this command to tell the other clients to call a custom method on an actor with a given id

        The command will be in the form: senderId METHOD actorId methodName param1 param2 param3...

        Custom methods should take String parameters and the method should parse them as needed

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CMD_REMOVE

        public static final java.lang.String CMD_REMOVE

        Command to remove an actor.

        The command will be in the form: senderId REMOVE actorId
        See Also:

      • handleOtherClientJoined

        public void handleOtherClientJoined​(java.lang.String clientId,
                                    Client client)
        When another client joins, if they are either in the same room as this client or this client and the other client are both not in a room, then for each LocalActor in this world, send a message to the other client to tell it to add an MPActor of the type returned by calling LocalActor.getOtherClass() on that LocalActor.
        Specified by:
        handleOtherClientJoined in interface ClientEventHandler
        Parameters:
        clientId - the id of the other client that joined
        client - a reference to this client

      • handleCommand

        public void handleCommand​(java.lang.String command,
                          Client client)
        handle messages from other clients. The following commands are automatically handled:
        • CMD_ADD: add an actor to the world. See getAddCmd(Class, int, int, Object...)
        • CMD_MOVE: Set the location of an actor. See getMoveCmd(String, int, int)
        • CMD_ROTATE: set the rotation of an actor. See getRotateCmd(String, int)
        • CMD_TRANSPARENCY: set the transparency of the image of an actor. See getTransparencyCmd(String, int)
        • CMD_MIRROR_HORIZONTALLY: mirror the image of an actor horizontally. See getMirrorHorizontallyCmd(String)
        • CMD_MIRROR_VERTICALLY: mirror the image of an actor vertically. See getMirrorVerticallyCmd(String)
        • CMD_SCALE: scale the image of an actor. See getScaleCmd(String, int, int)
        • CMD_METHOD: call a method on an actor. See getMethodCmd(String, String, Object...)
        • CMD_REMOVE: destroy an actor. See getRemoveCmd(String)
        Specified by:
        handleCommand in interface ClientEventHandler
        Parameters:
        command - the command
        client - the client

      • getAddCmd

        public static java.lang.String getAddCmd​(java.lang.Class<?> cls,
                                         int x,
                                         int y,
                                         java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Returns a string defining a CMD_ADD command. Note that the senderId will not be included in the command because that token is automatically added to the beginning of every command when it is broadcast. If the class is not a subclass of actor, the other clients will throw a ClassCastException when trying to handle the command.
        Parameters:
        cls - The class to make an instance of
        x - the x-coordinate of the position to add the actor
        y - the y-coordinate of the position to add the actor
        parameters - the parameters to pass to the constructor
        Returns:
        a String defining a CMD_ADD command

      • getMoveCmd

        public static java.lang.String getMoveCmd​(java.lang.String actorId,
                                          int x,
                                          int y)
        Returns a string defining a CMD_MOVE command.
        Parameters:
        actorId - the id of the actor to move
        x - the x-coordinate of the actor's new location
        y - the y-coordinate of the actor's new location
        Returns:
        a string defining a CMD_MOVE command

      • getImageCmd

        public static java.lang.String getImageCmd​(java.lang.String actorId,
                                           java.lang.String fileName)
        Returns a string defining a CMD_IMAGE command. The filename should be the name of an image file in the images folder of the scenario.
        Parameters:
        actorId - the id of the actor to set the image of
        fileName - the name of the file containing the image data
        Returns:
        a string defining a CMD_IMAGE command

      • getTransparencyCmd

        public static java.lang.String getTransparencyCmd​(java.lang.String actorId,
                                                  int transparency)
        Returns a string defining a CMD_TRANSPARENCY command. The transparency must be 0-255 or an exception will be thrown on the other clients.
        Parameters:
        actorId - the id of the actor to set the transparency of
        transparency - the transparency to set the image to
        Returns:
        a string defining a CMD_TRANSPARENCY command

      • onDisconnected

        public void onDisconnected​(Client client)
        This method is called when this client is disconnected from the server. By default this method calls Greenfoot.stop(). Subclasses should override this method to take actions after the client has been disconnected.
